Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2018 10:12PM Lissy19 wrote: Hello everyone again!!! I would like to give you an update on my situation. After going again to two of the doctors who had checked my breast in previous occassions, I decided to go again to the dermatologist as MBPooch suggested. I went and she told me she perceived that my left breast was bigger than my right breast, and she said my mammary gland seemed to be inflamed. She sent me to the breast surgeon as the situation was out of her speciality and she said that the eczema in the nipple was too little to make anything with it like a biopsy. I totally forgot to tell you that aside the rash I had since July 2013, I also perceived that my left breast became bigger than the right one as if new tissue had grown overnight in the zone after swimming in the ocean and covering my nipple with band aids. At the same time a brown two inch "beauty mark" appeared next to my left nipple. This facts made me suspect that I probably had Inflammatory Breast Cancer, especially the bigger left breast, back in September 2017. As my dermatologist is particular doctor, I had to go my family doctor for him to send me to the breast surgeon. However, he told me he only could perceive more tissue on the left breast rather than an inflammation as he had sent blood tests and said nothing in the tests could indicate an inflammatory process. He sent me again to another ultrasound. I don't know what to think right now as the ultrasounds never show a thing and I keep getting pains and rashes in my breast. I ask you: Do you think its possible that a 19 year old guy has inflammatory breast cancer or any kind of breast cancer? I'm really worried and the ultrasound won't happen until July. Thank you for your comprehension and answers.

Posts.Content: Lissy19 wrote: Hi First things first, I have to say I'm a 19 year old male who is suffering from various symptoms and I'm really worried that it might turn out to be breast cancer. Let me tell my story. When I was 14 years old, back in 2013, I went to a family trip to the beach. The first afternoon I went into the ocean, I started to notice a wild rash in my left nipple that wouldn't go away. I atributed it to the fact tht the salt water had simply caused an irritation on my skin and then decided to put on some band-aids over the affected nipple. When I removed them, I found out my nipple's appareance had changed because it seemed a little bit swollen. The allergic reaction to the salt water continued and I decided to stop swimming in the ocean. I noticed that soap also made my nipple itch. When I was back home, I went to the doctor and she said she hadn't found anything. Nonetheless, she prescribed me a cream that made my nipple itch once again. The symptoms appeared on July 2013 and they dissapeared in less than a month. I thought the problem was completely gone as it went away for six months. The situation resumed to a much lower degree in December 2013 but was soon gone again. Fast forward to October 2014, my problem had returned again. Only this time not only the nipple was itchy, but also my arm pit. I started to feel a weird sensation of electricity shocking down my arm, burning pain in my nipple, pain on the breast itself, and pain on the armpit. I was sent for an ultrasound which results came out clear. The symptoms went away for one month and a half, and then they returned in December of the same year. This time the symptoms lasted for a whole month and I was very insecure about going to the doctor again as I had gone just 2 months before and they would tell me not to bother with my problem. The problem went completely away in January 2015 and was gone for the rest of the year, 2016 came by and the problem seemed to be gone, and 8 months into 2017 seemed to prove that my problem had appearently been a puberty situation. I guess I was wrong, because the situation returned in September 2017, nearly 3 years after being completely gone. I believed that I couldn't get breast cancer because I did not have a lump in the breast, however I was always fearing of it. This time, the problem began when I noticed very small crustings on my left nipple. However, some even smaller crustings were also present on my right nipple. I went to my dermatologist and she checked my nipples. She decided to sent me clobetasol, and it worked for both nipples. However, I started to feel the itchiness in my armpit, and I started to suffer paresthesia on the skin of my forearm along with elbow pain. I started to get really worried about my health as I didn't know if there was a correlation between the two situations. This time I discovered on the internet that there was this disease called paget's disease of the nipple and some of my symptoms matched. I broke completely down with this discoveryI was fearing I had breast cancer that had metastized to my elbow and wrist and damaged my nerves. Once again I went to 2 doctors who once again checked my chest in search for lumps and found nothing. They touched my nipples and the texture of the skin and said everything seemed normal. I was sent for an ultrasound once again and nothing was found once again. An alternative doctor checked me and said he could not find anything. Once again, my problem was gone in a matter of weeks. Seven months went by and right now I found I'm experiencing this situation once again. The itchiness of my nipple has come back once again and has appeared along the arm symptoms it presented with previously. The muscles of my arm started to hurt as if I done any excercise and the forearm skin paresthesia appeared once again. I went to the doctor once again and through the physical exam they found nothing. Even the appareance of my nipple was fine. I'm terrified that this might turn out to be paget's disease of the nipple and I fear nobody is paying attention to the symptoms. No doctor has suggested a skin biopsy or even a MRI. I'm in a deep depresive state because I can't believe nearly no male teens get breast cancer and neither paget's disease. I need help please. Most of the doctors, family and friends tell me that my situation might only be stressed related and might be a somatization. The situation has only happened in drastic changes of my family's life and that is the only alternative explanation I find. I don't know where to go for help. Log in to post a reply
